description: #1a room 1 neutral cb surely known by someone but never posted. Stay neutral until after the cb, then hold up-right and dash around the right of the sign. Avoids difficult climbjump. Probably more frames to squeeze out here, but this loses a few frames and is much easier to optimize. Saved me a lot on average. Maybe good for mid-level city or full-game.

#1a #city Feel kinda silly posting this here but I see lots of people doing this differently so I think people should know about this: buffering the wallbounce, holding jump, and not doing any climb jumps is the fastest (reasonable) way to exit this room. The best I got with a single climb jump very late before the transition was breaking even accounting for the beginning of the next room too (losing one frame only looking at this room, so must save a frame in the next). Climb jumping more / earlier is slower. (I got the funny neutral cb thing the TAS does to save up to 2 frames but it's awful). So yeah, easiest exit here is also the fastest.

#1a #dashless crossing 1 corner jump set up. (having a jump + pause button is pretty much necessary)

For the first version:
Walk into the corner at the top left of the screen, then pause. While pausing, start holding right. Press a jump + pause key twice. Repeat this six more times (7 times in total). Then press pause, keep holding right, and buffer the climb jump.

For the second version:
Grab onto the wall as shown in the video, then drop down. Jump and hold right at the same time after reaching the ground. Keep holding jump and right until you are close to the wall. Then start holding grab and spam a jump + pause button while continuing to hold right and jump. Stop spamming the button after you have cleared the spikes, then make sure you are unpaused (keep holding right and jump). Most of the time you should have climb jumped 3 times, so you will need to recover your stamina with the dash crystal. Simply grab the left wall, climb jump, then jump over to the right wall.

The second version is about 1.2 seconds faster optimally, however its seems less consistent to me (sometimes you only jump twice which messes up the dash refill, if you start holding right to early after dropping from the wall that will also make it less consistent).

#7a #arb #f-08d

The goal here is to avoid the 3f window for the updash that everyone does (video of that one in thread). I use dash cooldown to line up a window where the updash can be buffered, and no other part of the room becomes harder

**pre-transition**
- buffer the down and down-right dashes after an extended hyper on the crumble block
- walk for 4-11 frames before dashing into the transition
    - its best to try to avoid the last 3 frames so the wallbounce inputs and cue can remain the same
    - walking does 3 things:
        - lines up timing to buffer the updash out of dash cooldown in the next room
        - prevent you from getting a hyper from buffering right dash out of crouch state
        - collect berry
- use any cue you like for where to dash

**post-transition**
 - buffer jump out of the transition
 - buffer updash out of dash cd
     - you can updash 1-2f after the buffer window depending on how few frames you walked before the transition

all of this loses 4f compared to the common alternative if both are done optimally, and loses up to 10f in the worst case (11 frames of walking)

#4a #arb old strat new cues, makes this way easier imo. 0.3-0.4 over updash
upleft demo into berry so you have crouched climbjumps, **hold left while climbjumping\***, release left after your last climbjump/after you hit dash crystal (pretty lenient either way), then **release jump during dash crystal freeze frames\*\*** and start holding right soon after your y position goes above the ledge. holding right gets a lot more lenient like this as well

**\***holding left while climbjumping prevents the long jump timer for wallboosts from existing, so your right press can't give you a sudden burst of x speed and make the right press timing a lot harder

**\*\***didn't realize at first, but checked w/TAS tools and it's impossible to be too low to get a landing if you release jump during dash crystal freeze frames, so it gives you a super clean landing every time. accidentally holding jump a little after the freeze frames is fine as well, just slightly slower

#7a #arb okay so that thing i posted before was bad because spring only moves you integer pixels towards the center and doesn't reset subpixels.  so this strat is a bit more complex but should actually be reliable: land on crumble blocks, buffer two updashes (doesn't matter whether you corner correct), buffer wallbounce (can be up to 5 frames later than buffered which makes it easier to make it over the spikes), full jump on the wallbounce, hold fastfall, hit the spring from the top, buffer a **left** dash (or demodash, doesn't matter) into the spring, and then you get that 7-frame window to upright dash into buffered updemo to the feather to line up the spike demo

Followup post to this cornerboost to try to explain it much better (its pretty good!)
first off, you **can** buffer the left dash cornerboost out of the spring, however to do so you have to do a **right dash** into the previous spring.
this puts you lower than an upright, and an upright makes you bonk your head which doesnt let you buffer for some position reason.
after doing a right dash into the previous spring, do the first upleft within the visual cue and buffer the 2nd one, then buffer the left dash.
the upleft window seems to be around 3f, maybe more.
i have not tas tested any of this, and my information could be slightly wrong. this is just a rough guide on it, but its way better than a 1f people thought.
saves ~.15

#3a science for this i hadn't really seen (similar strat is done in a few ILs tho), hyper -> release jump through transition -> hold right entire time = guaranteed 1f window for updash

if exactly 1 frame of hyper happens before transition, you have a 2f window to updash
for 2-5f of hyper before transition, it's a 1f window

for frames 1-3, the timing for the updash is consistent eg: from screen transition ending the updash occurs at the same frame for all 3 situations.  this makes it much easier to get muscle memory for but i'm not coping and calling it consistent or anything (overall consistency is about a coinflip for me).  for 4-5 it's delayed by 1 frame.

movement shown in vid works well for getting a super consistent 1-3f hyper through transition.  loses .1 - .2 over oshiro grounded ultra setup but has miles less variance and doesn't feel like utter bullshit

#3a demo setup
imo good setup for pausebuffering enthusiasts, from cutscene skip input a left demo into pausejump x3 in extension window (obviously can do pause pause jump pause if you don't have a pausejump bind) then pause 3 more times. the overall result is a 1 frame hyper + 1 frame advance which gives you the 1.5px setup so when you buffer the climbjump at the end you get an entire 8 frames for the demo (although that's a little misleading bc the pauses themselves are 5 frame windows.) i can lose around 0.5-0.6 consistently to a very fast 1px setup so worth a shot considering it's super consistent and you don't have to react to any pixels.
video shows one take of it as fast as i could get it and one with slow pauses to show what's going on
also shoutouts to owen for the idea

#9 #9a #Farewell #doubledash #DTS
very safe and consistent (imo) DTS Setup combining Gili's double updash setup and prof's pausebuffer setup.
- land on block
- wait until block hits the cue (same cue as gili's) then do 1 updash
- strafe left and do a fulljump neutral on the side of the block 
- frame advance when madeline is falling until it reaches cue to get corner correct 
- hold right and buffer dash from pause
- frame advance until cue (madeline off the edge)
- go neutral, buffer jump from paused, hold jump (to get neutral super)
- updash at peak then right dash to go over the trigger hitbox

#4c
buffered setup for bino storage, full hyper into the corner then upleft demo and buffer interact

edit for a more in depth explanation: the goal of the upleft dash is to be on the same y pixel as the bino while still moving upward. this way you can buffer the interact press without having to time a frame perfect jump, since you automatically move out of the binos range as you reach the peak of the dash. upleft demo works better since you have a consistent dash window at the peak of your jump (between frames 14 and 21), while an upleft dash at the peak of your jump will make you miss the pixel window where you can interact with the bino.

#4c bino interaction storage is 100% IL viable on 4C, no pausing.  pretty hard though, not worth unless going for 25 i think

tl;dr on what bino interaction storage is: canceling a bino interaction causes it to be stored - this resets madeline's state after moving through a screen transition, so you can cancel grounded ultras and jump out of them without getting a hyper.  i'll be making a full video on it this week.

1: bind a talk+jump bind
2: activate moving block as usual.  shortly after activating, jump left and upleft
3: after uplefting, wait a bit and start drifting right.  once you walk to the very edge of the wood platform, press the jump+talk bind and then do a reverse hyper from a wavedash.  don't rush this section too much or you'll bonk the block on the way up
your interaction is stored if madeline turns around a tiny bit before your jump goes off.  if you activate the bino as normal, you didn't drift far right enough.  if you turn around but don't jump, you weren't far enough right when you pressed the bind.  if you jump but don't see madeline turn around at all, then you jumped too late while drifting right (no bino interact).
the goal here is to press talk and then have the coyote jump get buffered after moving out of activation range of the bino.  it's basically same idea as my unbuffered DTS setup if you've messed with it but it's more lenient.  if at any point you aren't sure if you have an interact stored, grounded ultra through the left transition and if the dash gets canceled then it worked.
4: rest of this is straight forward albeit hard - first 3 steps are 100% consistent with practice, but this sucks lol.  you need to sweat the movement much harder than usual to make it into position for the frame perfect jump to the left wall, but it's doable.

as far as what to do with the canceled grounded ultra - only thing that wasn't complete horseshit was just the normal strat where the speed saves ~0.1 reaching the cloud https://streamable.com/cjmq47

#5c room 1 hcb setup (2f 1f 9f 1f windows, makes this room much more bearable than winging it)
1. demohyper and jump on the second or third extension frames, holding jump and right till 2:
2. updash for the wb on this frame, buffering jump for the wb and holding right: 
3. release jump on the wb in this 9f window, still holding right and buffering jump off the next dash block: 
4. dash right for the hcb exactly on this frame: 
5. buffer neutral cornerboost, holding right soon after. Alternatively, hold right while intentionally delaying the climbjump until you've already hit the wall
